Our Sponsors

About

Welcome to VITA at UCLA!

Founded in 1987, VITA at UCLA provides free federal and state income tax preparation assistance to low- to moderate-income, disabled, and elderly individuals in the Los Angeles community. It is our goal to help and educate people in filing tax returns to help clarify the process and provide assistance to those who otherwise would go without aid. Each year, we train approximately 200 UCLA undergraduate students in individual income tax preparation. In 2017, our volunteers served hundreds of clients, saving them over $450,000 through tax refunds and credits.

Volunteers

Students at UCLA may join VITA during Fall or Winter quarters. Volunteers will be equipped to file tax returns through extensive, interactive training sessions. Volunteers will learn about general tax concepts and tax situations for low-income, international, and elderly clients. Additionally, training sessions will include tax client simulations in order to train volunteers for client interactions. For Fall volunteers, training will take place over a 7 week period from Weeks 3 to 9 (no training on week 8), with an additional 2 weeks of training during Winter quarter in Weeks 1 and 2. For Winter volunteers, trainings are condensed into a 4 week course from Weeks 3 to 6. Tax sites will last from the end of January to mid-April.

Volunteer FAQs

  • Applying
  • Training
  • Other

  • Applying

  • How can I apply?
    Details about the application can be found here.
  • How many volunteers do you accept?
    We do not have a maximum cap for volunteers. If you are passionate about service and interested in learning more about taxes, we want you!
  • Do I have to be a particular major to apply?
    No, we accept all majors and minors, ranging from Business-Economics to Music Performance.
  • What if I have no experience working with taxes?
    No worries! We provide you all the necessary training during Fall or Winter quarter.

  • Training

  • When are the training dates?
    We have training most Tuesday and Sunday nights from 6 - 8 PM at designated locations.
  • Are presentation materials posted online?
    Yes, we try our best to post all of our training materials online for review shortly before the training date. Check your emails and/or the volunteer portal for updates!

  • Other

  • How can I become a QR if I am a returning volunteer?
    QR applications will be sent out to our official volunteers through email.
  • What is the time commitment?
    For Fall volunteers, the requirement is 12 hours for Winter and 9 hours for Spring quarter. For Winter volunteers, the requirement is 9 hours during the Winter and 9 hours during the Spring. For both Fall and Winter volunteers, you are required to complete at least 2 tax returns each quarter.
  • Are the info session slides posted online?
    Yes, the Fall 2019 info session slides can be accessed here.
